intro: Tricalysia longituba subsp. longituba, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture, while the flowers are clustered in terminal panicles. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or savanna habitats.
